name: py-nose

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: py-pyutilib
dependent_to.description:
The PyUtilib project supports a collection of Python utilities,
including a well-developed component architecture and extensions to the
PyUnit testing framework. PyUtilib has been developed to support several
Python-centric projects, especially Pyomo. PyUtilib is available under
the BSD License.

dependent_to.name: py-nosexcover
dependent_to.description:
A companion to the built-in nose.plugins.cover, this plugin will write
out an XML coverage report to a file named coverage.xml.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-goatools
dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms

dependent_to.name: cpat
dependent_to.description:
CPAT is an alignment-free method to predict RNA coding potential using
four sequence features

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: nest
dependent_to.description:
NEST is a simulator for spiking neural network models It focuses on the
dynamics, size and structure of neural systems rather than on the exact
morphology of individual neurons.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-annoy
dependent_to.description:
Annoy (Approximate Nearest Neighbors Oh Yeah) is a C++ library with
Python bindings to search for points in space that are close to a given
query point. It also creates large read-only file-based data structures
that are mmapped into memory so that many processes may share the same
data.

dependent_to.name: py-fparser
dependent_to.description:
This project is based upon the Fortran (77..2003) parser originally
developed by Pearu Peterson for the F2PY project, www.f2py.com. It
provides a parser for Fortran source code implemented purely in Python
with minimal dependencies.

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: py-rseqc
dependent_to.description:
RSeQC package provides a number of useful modules that can
comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-
seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-cloudbridge
dependent_to.description: A simple layer of abstraction over multiple cloud providers.

dependent_to.name: py-mikado
dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.

dependent_to.name: py-datalad
dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependent_to.name: seqan
dependent_to.description:
SeqAn is an open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data
structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological
data. Our library applies a unique generic design that guarantees high
performance, generality, extensibility, and integration with other
libraries. SeqAn is easy to use and simplifies the development of new
software tools with a minimal loss of performance

dependent_to.name: vigra
dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures
